item.title: Investing and Causation - Nick Krasney
item.description: Judea Pearl proposes three views of cause and effect: association, intervention, and counterfactuals. In this post, I speculate that this is a useful way to understand different investment classes—from passive index funds to leveraged buyouts to derivatives.

item.title: A Comparison of Modern Graphics APIs
item.description: Low level Graphics APIs such as Vulkan, DirectX, Metal, and WebGPU are converging to a model similar to the way GPUs are currently built. In this article we'll review modern graphics APIs and how they compare with older graphics APIs such as OpenGL in their design and data structures.
item.author: (Alain Galvan)

item.title: Pauls Online Math Notes
item.description: Welcome to my math notes site. Contained in this site are the notes (free and downloadable) that I use to teach Algebra, Calculus (I, II and III) as well as Differential Equations at Lamar University. The notes contain the usual topics that are taught in those courses as well as a few extra topics that I decided to include just because I wanted to. There are also a set of practice problems, with full solutions, to all of the classes except Differential Equations. In addition there is also a selection of cheat sheets available for download.

item.title: SAD DNS Explained
item.description: Researchers from UC Riverside and Tsinghua University found a new way to revive a decade-old DNS cache poisoning attack. Read our deep dive into how the SAD DNS attack on DNS resolvers works, how we protect against this attack in 1.1.1.1, and what the future holds for DNS cache poisoning attacks.
item.author: (Marek Vavruša)
